title: Daily Review
description: Start each session with a short review of previous learning to activate prerequisite knowledge.

title: Cold Calling
searchQuery: Cold calling pedagogy Doug Lemov example
description: Ask the question first, pause for thinking time, then select a student by name to answer.

title: Think, Pair, Share
description: Give students generic thinking time, then time to discuss with a partner before sharing with the class.

title: Dual Coding
searchQuery: Dual coding in the classroom Oliver Caviglioli
description: Combine verbal explanations with visual representations to reduce cognitive load.

title: Live Modelling
searchQuery: I do We do You do modelling strategy
description: The teacher works through a problem/task live under a visualiser or on screen, narrating their thought process.

title: Hinge Point Question
description: A diagnostic multiple-choice question where every wrong answer reveals a specific misconception.

title: Retrieval Grids
description: A grid of questions with varying point values based on how long ago the content was taught.

title: Cornell Notes
searchQuery: How to take Cornell notes for students
description: A systematic format for condensing and organizing notes, essential for HE progression.

title: No Opt Out
searchQuery: No opt out technique teach like a champion
description: A sequence that ensures a student who doesn't know the answer eventually gives the correct answer.

title: Show Me (MWB)
description: Whole-class response system using mini-whiteboards to check understanding of every student at once.

title: Frayer Model
description: A four-square graphic organizer for vocabulary development.

title: Exit Ticket
description: A single question or short task at the end of a lesson to inform planning for the next session.

title: Say It Again Better
searchQuery: Say it again better Tom Sherrington
description: Formative feedback technique to improve the quality of verbal responses.

title: Concrete Examples
description: Use specific examples to understand abstract ideas.

title: Interleaving
description: Switching between ideas during a study session rather than studying one topic for a long time.

title: Scaffolded Practice
description: Temporary supports that are gradually removed as students develop competence.

title: Fishbowl Debate
description: A small group discusses a topic in the center while the rest of the class observes.

title: Do Now (Prime)
searchQuery: Do Now activity examples Doug Lemov
description: A short activity written on the board that students start immediately upon entering.

title: Elaboration (Probing)
description: Asking 'How?' and 'Why?' to push student thinking further.

title: Silent Solo
description: Independent practice phase where students work entirely alone to consolidate fluency.

title: Zone of Relevance
description: Students place cards/terms onto a target board based on how relevant they are.

title: WAGOLL
description: What A Good One Looks Like. Analyzing a model answer to understand success criteria.

title: Austin's Butterfly
description: Specific, kind, and helpful critique to improve work through multiple drafts.

title: Diamond 9
description: Ranking 9 statements/factors in a diamond shape to encourage debate on priority.

title: Choral Response
description: Class responds in unison to a signal. Good for vocab, pronunciation, and factual check.

title: Wait Time
description: Deliberately pausing after asking a question to increase the quality and length of student answers.

title: Snowballing
description: Discussion that grows from individuals to pairs, to fours, to whole class.

title: Knowledge Organiser
description: A single page summarizing the core facts and vocabulary for a unit.

title: Stop and Jot
description: Short bursts of writing during discussion to ensure everyone is processing.

title: Gallery Walk
description: Work is displayed on walls/tables. Students move around to view and critique.

title: ABC Feedback
description: Structuring student responses to peers during discussion (Agree, Build, Challenge).

title: Jigsaw
description: Students become 'experts' in one part of a topic and then teach it to their home group.

title: What, How, Why
description: A writing frame to deepen analysis in written answers.

title: Gamified Quiz
description: Using digital tools (Kahoot, Blooket, Quizizz) for high-energy retrieval.

title: 3-2-1 Reflection
description: Write down: 3 Things you learned, 2 Things interesting, 1 Question you still have.
